glosses: (of weather) To become slightly cold, to become cool or chilly.
To feel a light coolness, to cool off.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish سرینلمك (serinlemek, “to cool, to become cool or chilly”), from سرین (serin, “cool, cold, chilly”), from Mongolian serixün (“cool, fresh”), morphologically serin + -le + -mek.
